messages.content: David Amess - Standing up for Southend West

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Seeking the title of City of Culture to highlight high standards of culture in the area.
Successfully implemented numerous initiatives to tackle local issues such as poverty.

issues.lawCrime: Warm Homes Act of 2001 to reduce fuel poverty and a measure to decrease crime

community.content: David is frequently in contact with local schools and charities. He works closely with Southend Hospital and does a huge amount of work for local charities and organisations. City of Culture to highlight high standards of culture in the area.

leaflet.personalStatement: David Amess was born in the East End of London and was educated at St Bonaventure’s in Forest Gate. He later obtained an external degree in economics (special subject government) at the London School of Economics. He taught in a junior school in Bethnal Green, worked for an insurance company in the City of London and ran a recruitment company for many years before entering Parliament for the first time in 1983. David has always lived in the constituency, with his family, since becoming the Member of Parliament.

endorsements.endorsement: Promoted by Nigel Holdcroft on behalf of David Amess.

quotes.text: David Amess - Best for Southend West

images.caption: David Amess with a prominent political figure.
